articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Yakima County Jail’s basement remains closed due to flooding
articles.description: YAKIMA, Wash. (AP) — The basement of the Yakima County jail remains shut down due to flooding. But the Yakima Herald-Republic reports that it’s expected to be operational by Tuesday. Jeremy Welch, Yakima County Department of Corrections chief, said crews are …

articles.title: Yakima County Jail's basement remains closed due to flooding
articles.description: YAKIMA, Wash. (AP) — The basement of the Yakima County jail remains shut down due to flooding.

articles.title: Jail basement reopens after flooding
articles.description: YAKIMA, Wash. (AP) — Two of three courtrooms in the Yakima County jail basement reopened after being flooded when a water pipe broke.

articles.author: Phil Ferolito
articles.title: Yakima County sheriff admits to missteps that freed felon who killed student in 2016
articles.description: Yakima sheriff and jail acknowledge slips in the release from jail of a man who went on to kill a 20-year-old Tieton missionary student in 2016. Public records show lapses.

articles.author: By MARTHA BELLISLE Associated Press
articles.title: Settlement in works over treatment of jailed mentally ill
articles.description: SEATTLE (AP) — Three years after a federal judge said Washington state is violating the constitutional rights of mentally ill people who must wait in jails for weeks for competency services, and two years after the judge held the state…

articles.author: Victoria Law
articles.title: Efforts to Decrease Prison Populations Are Leaving Women Behind
articles.description: (Image: Lauren Walker / Truthout ) For years, women have been the fastest-growing segment of people in prison. But recent efforts to decrease prison populations seem to be leaving them behind bars. In eight states, women's incarceration continues to increase …

articles.author: By Lynsi Burton, SeattlePI
articles.title: Rape kit backlog testing yields charge for 2007 Seattle rape, kidnapping
articles.description: When a woman identified as "TR" in police reports was raped in 2007, he rape kit was stashed in what became known as a rape kit backlog.
